prs.pr_title: Fix blocking subdomains of an already-blocked domain
prs.pr_body: Fixes #26374

issues.issue_title: adding subdomain block fails if base domain block already in place and also silently removes base domain block
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. add a domain block for `test.example`
2. add a domain block for `subdomain.test.example`

### Expected behaviour

At least one of the domain blocks should have remained in place, probably the base domain.

### Actual behaviour

The base domain block was mysteriously removed, and the subdomain block does not appear to have been added either, although it is logged as being added in the audit log.

### Detailed description

At a minimum, the base domain probably should be left in place.

Ideally, an information warning or error message should be generated to inform the user of whatever actual actions were taken, such as indicating failure and instructing them to remove the base domain first.

Audit log should accurately reflect whatever actions were actually taken.

### Mastodon instance

_No response_

### Mastodon version

v4.1.5

### Technical details

If this is happening on your own Mastodon server, please fill out those:
- Ruby version: ruby 3.0.6p216 (2023-03-30 revision 23a532679b) [x86_64-linux]
- Node.js version: v16.20.1

commit.commit_title: Use migration classes in migrations where current definition conflicts with older (#26390)

prs.pr_title: Use migration classes in migrations where current definition conflicts with older
prs.pr_body:
_Extracted from https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/25963_

As noted on that Rails 7.1 PR, there's a change in Rails main which leads to an `enum` declaration erroring out earlier than previously if a column does not exist. As a result, these migrations which run fine in main right now, throw up errors on the Rails 7.1 PR branch.

I generally dislike changing old migrations, but similar to - https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26178 - these all strike me as so old that they are unlikely to ever actually be run in production? (presumably anyone upgrading is closer to current than these migrations, and any new instances or dev environments would just load the current schema and only ever apply newer migrations, so it seems safe). As far as I can tell, the generated sql and migration changes remain the same.

A previous commit added the profiling gems to both test/development environments: https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/25383

During this change, we added some rspec type auto inference code, and as part of that change we moved the fabricator spec to sit in the spec/fabricators/ directory.

This had an unintended side effect of breaking the use of `Fabricate` from with in the Rails console.

When rails/bootsnap loads all the fabricators, that file requires `rails_helper` which throws an error.

This change moves the fabricator spec out of the fabricator-defining dir, and into another directory.

This preserves the behavior of this file as a spec, and fixes the broken console behavior.

I saw OpenAI allow you to opt out of indexing by their model data crawler: https://platform.openai.com/docs/gptbot

Maybe we want this on by default? Maybe that's too opinionated? Thought I'd propose it at least 🙂

commit.commit_title: Avoid connecting to a running ES instance in ES search check spec (#26413)

prs.pr_title: Avoid connecting to a running ES instance in ES search check spec
prs.pr_body:
While working on https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26399 I realized that of the two "missing version" examples in the system check spec, only one of them is actually stubbing out an ES response; the other is just relying on an ES server not running so it fails that way.

That means that if an ES server *is running* the spec will connect to it (and fail).

This changes the spec to fully stub out the ES connection in both of the "missing version" examples.

commit.commit_title: Change the hashtag column to not display the hashtag header on pinned columns (#26416)

prs.pr_title: Change the hashtag column to not display the hashtag header on pinned columns
prs.pr_body:
#26362 added a header to hashtag timelines and moved the follow button there.

If someone has a pinned column for a hashtag In the advanced (multi-column) interface, they are probably not interested in following it (having the posts from this hashtag show up in their Home timeline).

This PR keeps the header in un-pinned columns so that following/unfollowing remains easy and discoverable.

issues.issue_title: not everyone can view photos
issues.issue_body:
I'm seeing some inconsistencies in the ability to view posted photos in the last few days.

Some can't see mine, but I can see mine, my instance can see mine (according to the little feedback I've had but that might have been coincidence). I can see some others' photos, but a few I can't. Using Amaroq, I can't get to the photos at all, but at my computer, if I go all the way to the user's homepage (rather than having it come up in the right column) so far I can see them. I've spoken to one other user who noticed the problem, too.

* **

- [ ] I searched or browsed the repo’s other issues to ensure this is not a duplicate.

issues.issue_title: Enhancement Idea: Bookmarks for Private Use
issues.issue_body:
I'd enjoy bookmarking posts in addition to favorites as well (and these can be shared with approved followers or not). I like how ig incorporated this feature but they're doing it to better farm us bc we would take screenshots for private.

I think a bookmark feature could be more productive to the end-user as opposed to outwardly facing. For example, someone could not only sort bookmarks later but add a reminder to follow-up or even forward?  That's the best thing about Mastodon is that the content is meant to be beneficial to our lives and not the other way around for shareholders.  It'd be great to curate some things easily. Private tags would probably be too complex in addition to the bookmarks but you see where I'm going. 

This could be a great feature for future corporate accounts too needing to manage customers from their instance to respond to: features, bugs, customer support, routing to a moderator on their instance that handles customer support, etc. The api would be a wonderful hook too for productivity into other apps like the widely used slack, etc.

Thanks for all the great work. Amazing.

issues.issue_title: the dump-notifs option and how to improve it
issues.issue_body:
first: a confirm (yes/no) would be really great, or an undo option, if that's possible.
i would also suggest moving it from the column title itself into the notification options, and to make it present there in all columns

if the yes/no confirm exists, it would also be extremely useful to be able to require a confirm when boosting things. whether that be all posts or just a setting isnt a big deal to me.

issues.issue_title: confirm dialog for boosts
issues.issue_body: if a yes/no confirm is possible, it would be extremely useful to be able to require a confirm when boosting things. whether that be all posts or just a setting to turn on isn't a big deal to me. i've seen many complaints for this

issues.issue_title: Higher-contrast accessibility option
issues.issue_body:
As noted on [this toot](https://computerfairi.es/users/maunzikation/updates/2884), Mastodon's default style is not accessible to all. There are technical work-arounds (userstyles and such), but they may imply the help from other people or a certain technical knowledge to be useful.

An option to a higher-contrast, higher-visible interface would be nice, especially if offered from the get-go through the welcome screens.

Reference: https://computerfairi.es/users/maunzikation/updates/2884

* * * *

- [ * ] I searched or browsed the repo’s other issues to ensure this is not a duplicate.

issues.issue_title: Revert "Do not override timestamps for incoming toots"
issues.issue_body: Reverts tootsuite/mastodon#7326

issues.issue_title: Fixes/do not override timestamps
issues.issue_body:
Follow-up to #7326 and #7330, sorry for the noise.

The changes in behavior are the following:
- The toot's publication date is set by the originating instance regardless of how the toot has been retrieved
- As a side effect, late (> 6h) incoming toots do not show up in timelines anymore (should still show up in notifications). I think this is acceptable, but this might be debated.

issues.issue_title: Add instance actor (second take)
issues.issue_body:
#10457 but using an actual `Account` with the following tricks:
- use `instance.tld` as username, to make sure we're not hitting an existing username
- use `Application` as `actor_type` and `0` as `id` to uniquely
- only serialize a subset of the `Actor` fields
- use its own route and controller to make it unique and avoid issues with dots in paths

It seems to work, I am not sure what may be missing but I haven't actually tested federating with it yet.

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/compare/v8.10.0...v9.0.0)

-   Added: The CLI helper tool now works with eslint.config.js (flat config). Just like ESLint itself, the CLI tool automatically first tries eslint.config.js and then eslintrc, and you can force which one to use by setting the \[ESLINT_USE_FLAT_CONFIG] environment variable. Note that the *config* of eslint-config-prettier has always been compatible with eslint.config.js (flat config) – it was just the CLI tool that needed updating. On top of that, the docs have been updated to mention how to use both eslint.config.js (flat config) and eslintrc, and the tests now test both config systems.
-   Changed: \[unicode-bom] is no longer turned off. Prettier preserves the BOM if you have one, and does not add one if missing. It was wrong of eslint-config-prettier to disable that rule. If you get ESLint errors after upgrading, either add `"unicode-bom": "off"` to your config to disable it again, or run ESLint with `--fix` to fix all files according to the rule (add or remove BOM). Thanks to Nicolas Stepien ([@​nstepien](https://togithub.com/nstepien))!

</details>

issues.issue_title: Update account password in admin interface
issues.issue_body:
Add feature to update account password (or email) in admin interface.
Of course it's possible for locale user only.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15029076/24980241/baf9f7fa-1fd7-11e7-9976-9cb567b5802e.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15029076/24980298/eb55e01c-1fd7-11e7-9469-da667a221a7f.png)

If password and password_confirmation are empty only email will be updated.
If password is updated user will receive a confirmation email.

Related to #146

-   1 minor enhancement:

    -   Robb Shecter changed the default log level for duplicate type variant from
        `warn` to `debug` in \[[#​170](https://togithub.com/mime-types/ruby-mime-types/issues/170)]\[]. This works because `MIME::Types.logger` is
        intended to fit the `::Logger` interface, and the default logger
        (`WarnLogger`) is a subclass of `::Logger` that passes through to

        -   Further consideration has changed cache load messages from `warn` to
            `error` and deprecation messages from `warn` to `debug`.

-   1 bug fix:

    -   Update the .github/workflows/ci.yml workflow to test Ruby 3.2 and more
        reliably test certain combinations rather than depending on exclusions.

    -   Change `.standard.yml` configuration to format for Ruby 2.3 as certain files
        are not properly detected with Ruby 2.0.

issues.issue_title: unlisted toggle and persistence to allow unlisted accounts to stay unlisted easier
issues.issue_body:
i believe there is another thing that can be done for accessibility sake: the checkbox could retain it's checkedness between sessions. ie: if you close the site and reopen: the checkbox would still be checked if it was when you closed it. this is especially an issue bc closing the public timeline, or clicking things can easily reset the toggle to be a public toot.

update/new thought! the easiest way to resolve this issue is to bring back the settings listed or unlisted with the title "default publicity" or the like, to allow the user to select what to default back to

| Package | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|
| [rails](https://rubyonrails.org) ([source](https://togithub.com/rails/rails), [changelog](https://togithub.com/rails/rails/releases/tag/v7.0.7)) | patch | `7.0.6` -> `7.0.7` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>rails/rails (rails)</summary>

### [`v7.0.7`](https://togithub.com/rails/rails/releases/tag/v7.0.7): 7.0.7

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rails/rails/compare/v7.0.6...v7.0.7)

#### Active Support

-   Fix `Cache::NullStore` with local caching for repeated reads.

    *fatkodima*

-   Fix `to_s` with no arguments not respecting custom `:default` formats

    *Hartley McGuire*

-   Fix `ActiveSupport::Inflector.humanize(nil)` raising ``NoMethodError: undefined method `end_with?' for nil:NilClass``.

    *James Robinson*

-   Fix `Enumerable#sum` for `Enumerator#lazy`.

    *fatkodima*, *Matthew Draper*, *Jonathan Hefner*

-   Improve error message when EventedFileUpdateChecker is used without a
    compatible version of the Listen gem

    *Hartley McGuire*

#### Active Model

-   Error.full_message now strips ":base" from the message.

    *zzak*

-   Add a load hook for `ActiveModel::Model` (named `active_model`) to match the load hook for
    `ActiveRecord::Base` and allow for overriding aspects of the `ActiveModel::Model` class.

#### Active Record

-   Restores functionality to the missing method when using enums and fixes.

    *paulreece*

-   Fix `StatementCache::Substitute` with serialized type.

    *ywenc*

-   Fix `:db_runtime` on notification payload when application have multiple databases.

    *Eileen M. Uchitelle*

-   Correctly dump check constraints for MySQL 8.0.16+.

    *Steve Hill*

-   Fix `ActiveRecord::QueryMethods#in_order_of` to include `nil`s, to match the
    behavior of `Enumerable#in_order_of`.

    For example, `Post.in_order_of(:title, [nil, "foo"])` will now include posts
    with `nil` titles, the same as `Post.all.to_a.in_order_of(:title, [nil, "foo"])`.

    *fatkodima*

-   Revert "Fix autosave associations with validations added on `:base` of the associated objects."

    This change intended to remove the :base attribute from the message,
    but broke many assumptions which key these errors were stored.

    *zzak*

-   Fix `#previously_new_record?` to return true for destroyed records.

    Before, if a record was created and then destroyed, `#previously_new_record?` would return true.
    Now, any UPDATE or DELETE to a record is considered a change, and will result in `#previously_new_record?`
    returning false.

    *Adrianna Chang*

-   Revert breaking changes to `has_one` relationship deleting the old record before the new one is validated.

    *zzak*

-   Fix support for Active Record instances being uses in queries.

    As of `7.0.5`, query arguments were deep duped to avoid mutations impacting
    the query cache, but this had the adverse effect to clearing the primary key when
    the query argument contained an `ActiveRecord::Base` instance.

    This broke the `noticed` gem.

    *Jean Boussier*

#### Action View

-   Fix `render collection: @​records, cache: true` to cache fragments as bare strings

    Previously it would incorrectly cache them as Action View buffers.

    *Jean Boussier*

-   Don't double-encode nested `field_id` and `field_name` index values

    Pass `index: @​options` as a default keyword argument to `field_id` and
    `field_name` view helper methods.

    *Sean Doyle*

#### Action Pack

-   No changes.

#### Active Job

-   No changes.

#### Action Mailer

-   No changes.

#### Action Cable

-   No changes.

#### Active Storage

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>rails/rails (@​rails/ujs)</summary>

### [`v7.0.7`](https://togithub.com/rails/rails/releases/tag/v7.0.7): 7.0.7

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rails/rails/compare/v7.0.6...v7.0.7)

#### Active Support

-   Fix `Cache::NullStore` with local caching for repeated reads.

    *fatkodima*

-   Fix `to_s` with no arguments not respecting custom `:default` formats

    *Hartley McGuire*

-   Fix `ActiveSupport::Inflector.humanize(nil)` raising ``NoMethodError: undefined method `end_with?' for nil:NilClass``.

    *James Robinson*

-   Fix `Enumerable#sum` for `Enumerator#lazy`.

    *fatkodima*, *Matthew Draper*, *Jonathan Hefner*

-   Improve error message when EventedFileUpdateChecker is used without a
    compatible version of the Listen gem

    *Hartley McGuire*

#### Active Model

-   Error.full_message now strips ":base" from the message.

    *zzak*

-   Add a load hook for `ActiveModel::Model` (named `active_model`) to match the load hook for
    `ActiveRecord::Base` and allow for overriding aspects of the `ActiveModel::Model` class.

#### Active Record

-   Restores functionality to the missing method when using enums and fixes.

    *paulreece*

-   Fix `StatementCache::Substitute` with serialized type.

    *ywenc*

-   Fix `:db_runtime` on notification payload when application have multiple databases.

    *Eileen M. Uchitelle*

-   Correctly dump check constraints for MySQL 8.0.16+.

    *Steve Hill*

-   Fix `ActiveRecord::QueryMethods#in_order_of` to include `nil`s, to match the
    behavior of `Enumerable#in_order_of`.

    For example, `Post.in_order_of(:title, [nil, "foo"])` will now include posts
    with `nil` titles, the same as `Post.all.to_a.in_order_of(:title, [nil, "foo"])`.

    *fatkodima*

-   Revert "Fix autosave associations with validations added on `:base` of the associated objects."

    This change intended to remove the :base attribute from the message,
    but broke many assumptions which key these errors were stored.

    *zzak*

-   Fix `#previously_new_record?` to return true for destroyed records.

    Before, if a record was created and then destroyed, `#previously_new_record?` would return true.
    Now, any UPDATE or DELETE to a record is considered a change, and will result in `#previously_new_record?`
    returning false.

    *Adrianna Chang*

-   Revert breaking changes to `has_one` relationship deleting the old record before the new one is validated.

    *zzak*

-   Fix support for Active Record instances being uses in queries.

    As of `7.0.5`, query arguments were deep duped to avoid mutations impacting
    the query cache, but this had the adverse effect to clearing the primary key when
    the query argument contained an `ActiveRecord::Base` instance.

    This broke the `noticed` gem.

    *Jean Boussier*

#### Action View

-   Fix `render collection: @​records, cache: true` to cache fragments as bare strings

    Previously it would incorrectly cache them as Action View buffers.

    *Jean Boussier*

-   Don't double-encode nested `field_id` and `field_name` index values

    Pass `index: @​options` as a default keyword argument to `field_id` and
    `field_name` view helper methods.

    *Sean Doyle*

#### Action Pack

-   No changes.

-   No changes.

-   No changes.

-   No changes.

-   No changes.

issues.issue_title: Load images from IPFS
issues.issue_body:
It would be great if mastodon was using [ipfs](https://ipfs.io/) to load/store images. This way if a server goes down the content would stay up if someone else has loaded it. It would also reduce the bandwidth on the server hosting the original content.

To elaborate only the backend needs to run IPFS. The users could but that needs to be optional.

issues.issue_title: Video / Audio uploads fails with Cloudflare R2
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Upload a video file

### Expected behaviour

Video upload works

### Actual behaviour

Video upload doesn't work

### Detailed description

Sidekiq fails to fetch the original file uploaded to s3 : 

commit.commit_title: Fix "Create Account" button in interaction modal (#26459)

prs.pr_title: Fix "Create Account" button in interaction modal
prs.pr_body:
This fixes following issues:

1. In closed registrations, modal not changing by clicking on the button.
2. Custom signup URL configured in the `SSO_ACCOUNT_SIGN_UP` environment variable not overrides the button's link-to.

## Steps to reproduce the first one

1. Disable registrations in server settings
2. Logout from Mastodon
3. Click follow button on someone's profile
4. Click the "Create Account" button in the interaction modal

### Expected behavior

The interaction modal closing then the closed-registrations modal opening.

### Actual behavior

Nothing happens.

## Steps to reproduce the second one

1. Set custom signup URL with define `SSO_ACCOUNT_SIGN_UP` variable in .env
2. Open the interaction modal

### Expected behavior

The "Create Account" button linked to the customized signup URL.

### Actual behavior

The "Create Account" button linked to `/auth/sign_up` the default signup URL.

## Changes:

### Updates to account for Renovate 36 release: [^1]

- Rename `config:base` to `config:recommended`
- Rename `stabilityDays` to `minimumReleaseAge` [^4]
- Use `':prConcurrentLimitNone'` so there's no limit to the number of open PRs at one time
- Limit PR creation to 2 per hour with `':prHourlyLimit2'`

### Improvements to your workflow:

- Drop `':dependencyDashboard',` because it's included in `config:recommended` [^2]
- Instead of disabling Renovate for certain `major` type updates, use the Dependency Dashboard Approval workflow [^3]
- Use `dependencyDashboardHeader` to remind Mastodon maintainers to check the `renovate.json5` file before approving any updates from the Dependency Dashboard

## Context:

I'm combining a small housekeeping update with a **big change** to your Renovate update workflow. I see you're currently _disabling_ Renovate for certain `major` type updates. I recommend you instead use the Dependency Dashboard workflow. [^3]

Pinging @renchap, because they discussed some problems on the Renovate repository recently. They also updated your Renovate config recently. So I want to make sure they see my PR. 😉 

### Benefits of new workflow:

- You can always see `major` updates in your Dependency Dashboard, and can get them when needed
- You always see if you're using old dependencies in your Dependency Dashboard, right now you don't see some `major` updates at all

### Drawbacks:

- You may accidentally select a `major` update that breaks stuff from the Dependency Dashboard
- The Dependency Dashboard will show more updates (because you're currently not seeing those at all...)

[^1]: [Renovate docs, release notes for 36](https://docs.renovatebot.com/release-notes-for-major-versions/#version-36)
[^2]: [Renovate docs, `config:recommended` preset](https://docs.renovatebot.com/presets-config/#configrecommended)
[^3]: [Renovate docs, require approval for `major` updates](https://docs.renovatebot.com/key-concepts/dashboard/#require-approval-for-major-updates)
[^4]: [Renovate docs, `minimumReleaseAge`](https://docs.renovatebot.com/configuration-options/#minimumreleaseage)

prs.pr_body:
While #26483 added an environment variable to set the number of replicas, Chewy has its own internal index which did not make use of this.

This also adds a `--reset-chewy` flag to `tootctl search deploy` to reset that index, as `tootctl search deploy` will not currently reset it.

commit.commit_title: Fix hashtag bar display when status is in a thread (#26497)

prs.pr_title: Fix hashtag bar display when status is in a thread
prs.pr_body:
This is related to the changes introduced in #26492. Currently, the hashtag bar in statuses which are part of a thread is covered by the thread line, when said status is not open/focused. I added `hashtag-bar` to the list of classes that when inside of a status in thread should have a margin. 

Before/After:

issues.issue_title: Add the ability to write instance's rules in several languages
issues.issue_body:
At the moment, there is no practical way to display the content of the /about, /about/more and /terms pages in several languages. Sure, you can put the different versions of the same text inside `<div lang="x">` tags (that's what we do at Eldritch Café, see [/about/more](https://eldritch.cafe/about/more)) but it requires that the admin is familiar with HTML and it can makes really long pages as a result. Moreover, as for Mastodon 2.4.5, you can't even use this method on the /about page since the text must stay short (this is going to change in Mastodon 2.5).
I would suggest that Mastodon use a similar function that the one currently used on [Liberapay](https://liberapay.com/). The website allow you to write a description in various languages (see screenshot). We could do the same thing, using the browser's language to display the right text, with a fallback on the instance's default language in case the text hasen't been translated in one of favorite languages of the user.

![Screenshot of Liberapay's interface.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5222316/44618876-7958ab80-a87e-11e8-8081-0c9dd2baea1e.png)

* * * *

- [x] I searched or browsed the repo’s other issues to ensure this is not a duplicate.

prs.pr_title: Change “privacy and reach” settings so that unchecking boxes always increase privacy and checking them always increase reach
prs.pr_body:
Fixes #26493 (with some wording changes)

## Before

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/9e525e89-5556-4eab-8e02-985a7e1b12c9)

## After

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/a76ddb17-e35f-4260-a9dd-694e4c7f57e1)

issues.issue_title: Privacy and reach: unify settings so "all boxes checked" = "most discoverable/public"
issues.issue_body:
## Pitch

On the `Privacy and reach` panel, invert the name and default for two existing settings so "all boxes checked" means "most discoverable/public"

| Old | Old setting name | … | New | New setting name
|------------------|---------------------------|----|-------------------|---------------------------
❌ | `Manually review new followers` | ➡ | ✔️  | `Automatically accept new followers`
❌ | `Hide follows and followers from profile` | ➡ | ✔️  | `Show follows and followers on profile`

**The resulting outcome remains the same as before.**  Accounts will still be unlocked by default (`locked` = `false`) and not hide followers/followed by (`hide_collections` = `false`).¹

This merely changes how it's presented to the user at the UI layer using [the new `setting_inverse_alias()` function introduced with the privacy tab](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26484 ).

```ruby
# Example addition to app/models/user_settings.rb
setting_inverse_alias :unlocked, :locked
setting_inverse_alias :show_collections, :hide_collections
```

New hint text:
* `Automatically accept new followers`
  * `People can follow you without requesting approval and you will not need to accept or reject new followers.`
* `Show follows and followers on profile`
  * `People can browse through your follows and followers.  People you follow will see that you follow them regardless.`

¹ Some folks pointed out wanting to change these defaults, or letting the instance administrator configure the defaults.  If so, I'd suggest doing that separately for easier review.

*[Feature request is sourced from my past comment](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26344#issuecomment-1676195299)*

## Motivation

* Makes it easier to opt in to the traditional social media experience ("just check all the boxes on this page!")
* Simplifies locking down one's account if being harassed ("uncheck all of the boxes on this page")
* Potentially reduces cognitive load by keeping a consistent privacy outcome (becoming more public/discoverable/reachable) for each checkbox

## Example mockup screenshots
### Before
![Screenshot of the "Privacy and reach" settings panel showing "Manually review new followers" and "Hide follows and followers from profile" unchecked](https://zorro.casa/sync/Hosting/Utilities/Development/Mastodon/issues/privacy%20unify%20checkboxes/Privacy%20and%20reach%20-%20before.png#v2)
> * `Manually review new followers`
>   * `People will request to follow you and you will be able to accept or reject new followers.`
> * `Hide follows and followers from profile`
>   * `People will not be able to browse through your follows and followers.  People you follow will see that you follow them regardless.`

### After
![Screenshot of the "Privacy and reach" settings panel showing "Automatically accept new followers" and "Show follows and followers on profile" checked and recommended](https://zorro.casa/sync/Hosting/Utilities/Development/Mastodon/issues/privacy%20unify%20checkboxes/Privacy%20and%20reach%20-%20after%20mockup.png#v2)
> * `Automatically accept new followers` (recommended)
>   * `People can follow you without requesting approval and you will not need to accept or reject new followers.`
> * `Show follows and followers on profile` (recommended)
>   * `People can browse through your follows and followers.  People you follow will see that you follow them regardless.`

commit.commit_title: Allow setting a custom HTTP method in CacheBuster (#26528)

prs.pr_title: Allow setting a custom HTTP method in CacheBuster
prs.pr_body:
This is needed for some CDN providers, for example Fastly, as you need to use a custom `PURGE` HTTP method for purges.

In Fastly's case, you can use an API key scoped to your service and restricted to purging only in the headers.

HTTP.rb does not support the `PURGE` method, so we need to monkey-patch it (https://github.com/httprb/http/pull/757 for upstream change).

I also added a spec for the cache buster feature.

To maintain compatibility, you need to specify an HTTP method if you want to not send any headers. We should probably deprecate the default headers, and clean up this code in the next version.

Replaces #26224

Fixes https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/issues/14779

Currently it is not possible to upload a screen recording made using the build-in tool in Gnome because of this check:

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/blob/df6e7198984b42cf8d64e66548742e14264236a0/app/models/media_attachment.rb#L351

~According to this: https://dataloop.ai/docs/webm-file-format for WebM containers `avg_frame_rate = r_frame_rate`, I believe this is a sane default if avg_frame_rate is nil~

issues.issue_title: Streaming server cannot handle DATABASE_URL without password and separate DB_PASS
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

Set `DATABASE_URL` without DB password, and provide DB password through `DB_PASS`.

### Expected behaviour

Web and streaming servers could connect to database.

### Actual behaviour

Streaming server could not connect to database.

### Detailed description

Let the values of ENV vars be
```
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user@dbhost.example.com:5432/mastodon_production
DB_PASS=mypassword
```

and `Rails.application.config.database_configuration[Rails.env]` in rails console looks like
```
   "database"=>"mastodon_production",
   "username"=>"user",
   "password"=>"mypassword",
   "host"=>"dbhost.example.com",
   "port"=>5432,
```

while `pgConfigFromEnv(process.env)` in Node is
```
> pgConfigFromEnv(process.env)
{
  user: 'user',
  password: '',
  port: '5432',
  host: 'dbhost.example.com',
  database: 'mastodon_production',
  max: 10,
  connectionTimeoutMillis: 15000,
  application_name: ''
}
```

I have tried this setup because this is a k8s deployment and `DATABASE_URL` is provided through configmap while `DB_PASS` is from secret.

### Mastodon instance

t.kaikoga.net

### Mastodon version

v4.1.5+nightly-2023-07-30

### Technical details

If this is happening on your own Mastodon server, please fill out those:
- Ruby version: ruby 3.2.2 (2023-03-30 revision e51014f9c0) [x86_64-linux]
- Node.js version: v16.20.1

issues.issue_title: Scheduler::FollowRecommendationsScheduler takes days and reads over 24TB from db
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem


1. Run the Scheduler::FollowRecommendationsScheduler scheduled query and it takes at least 27 hours to run, it's a daily scheduled query so they pile up on the DB and slow it down. 

```
EXPLAIN (analyze, buffers) SELECT
  account_id,
  sum(rank) AS rank,
  array_agg(reason) AS reason
FROM (
  SELECT
    account_summaries.account_id AS account_id,
    count(follows.id) / (1.0 + count(follows.id)) AS rank,
    'most_followed' AS reason
  FROM follows
  INNER JOIN account_summaries ON account_summaries.account_id = follows.target_account_id
  INNER JOIN users ON users.account_id = follows.account_id
  LEFT OUTER JOIN follow_recommendation_suppressions ON follow_recommendation_suppressions.account_id = follows.target_account_id
  WHERE users.current_sign_in_at >= (now() - interval '30 days')
    AND account_summaries.sensitive = 'f'
    AND follow_recommendation_suppressions.id IS NULL
  GROUP BY account_summaries.account_id
  HAVING count(follows.id) >= 5
  UNION ALL
  SELECT account_summaries.account_id AS account_id,
         sum(status_stats.reblogs_count + status_stats.favourites_count) / (1.0 + sum(status_stats.reblogs_count + status_stats.favourites_count)) AS rank,
         'most_interactions' AS reason
  FROM status_stats
  INNER JOIN statuses ON statuses.id = status_stats.status_id
  INNER JOIN account_summaries ON account_summaries.account_id = statuses.account_id
  LEFT OUTER JOIN follow_recommendation_suppressions ON follow_recommendation_suppressions.account_id = statuses.account_id
  WHERE statuses.id >= ((date_part('epoch', now() - interval '30 days') * 1000)::bigint << 16)
    AND account_summaries.sensitive = 'f'
    AND follow_recommendation_suppressions.id IS NULL
  GROUP BY account_summaries.account_id
  HAVING sum(status_stats.reblogs_count + status_stats.favourites_count) >= 5
) t0
GROUP BY account_id
ORDER BY rank DESC;
                                                                                                           QUERY PLAN                                                                                                           
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Sort  (cost=3593985.86..3593985.87 rows=2 width=72) (actual time=112104413.401..112104415.499 rows=29919 loops=1)
   Sort Key: (sum((((count(follows.id))::numeric / (1.0 + (count(follows.id))::numeric))))) DESC
   Sort Method: quicksort  Memory: 4976kB
   Buffers: shared hit=31839911 read=3294071 dirtied=1025 written=26, temp read=3130289577 written=9879
   ->  GroupAggregate  (cost=10126.46..3593985.85 rows=2 width=72) (actual time=148491.041..112104235.557 rows=29919 loops=1)
         Group Key: account_summaries.account_id
         Buffers: shared hit=31839911 read=3294071 dirtied=1025 written=26, temp read=3130289577 written=9879
         ->  Merge Append  (cost=10126.46..3593985.81 rows=2 width=72) (actual time=148490.251..112103838.120 rows=32478 loops=1)
               Sort Key: account_summaries.account_id
               Buffers: shared hit=31839911 read=3294071 dirtied=1025 written=26, temp read=3130289577 written=9879
               ->  GroupAggregate  (cost=9122.61..9122.65 rows=1 width=72) (actual time=1817.853..2186.162 rows=3758 loops=1)
                     Group Key: account_summaries.account_id
```

### Expected behaviour

The query should not take so long and read the DB for TB of data

### Actual behaviour

The query takes a long time to run and is reading TB of data

### Detailed description

I started seeing Scheduler::FollowRecommendationsScheduler piling up as a scheduled query in sidekiq and a lot of the qureies being run at the same time I ended up having to kill them manually. 

So I start looking into the query and run it manually and the query did finish roughly 27 hours later.  Running the query with EXPLAIN( buffers, analyze) I see that this query is if I am reading the results right reading 24TB of data out of the DB. 

### Specifications

mastodon 4.1.2

prs.pr_body:
On `/settings/profile` the JavaScript for showing a preview of the selected profile picture prior to upload is broken.

This PR fixes the script, combines the code for avatar and account header images, makes the empty preview fields visible even when no image is currently saved in the database, and ensures that the avatar preview is cropped to a square.

commit.commit_title: Add ability to delete avatar or header picture via the API (#25124)

prs.pr_title: Add ability to delete avatar or header picture via the API
prs.pr_body:
This PR adds a new endpoint to the API which allows deleting the avatar or header picture of an account's profile.

**New endpoint:** `DELETE /api/v1/profile/:image`. Where `image` can be either `avatar` or `header`.
**Scope:** `write:accounts`.

If accepted, should close  #18921.

EDIT:

Documentation PR: mastodon/documentation#1238.

issues.issue_title: Allow deleting your avatar and header via the /api endpoints
issues.issue_body:
### Pitch

Either new endpoints, or modify `PATCH /api/v1/accounts/update_credentials` in the credentials_controller.rb to accept empty or special values for `avatar` and `header` parameters

### Motivation

Currently this appears to be done via `DELETE /settings/profile/pictures/avatar` or `DELETE /settings/profile/pictures/header` but it should also be accessible via the Mastodon API officially and not just internally.

issues.issue_title: Add reference to Elixir client for Mastodon API

commit.commit_title: Do not start LibreTranslate and Elasticsearch on GitHub Codespaces (#26382)

prs.pr_title: Do not start LibreTranslate and Elasticsearch on GitHub Codespaces
prs.pr_body:
The free tier on GitHub Codespaces only include 32 GB storage. It seems this is not enough to boot the full environment.

I'm not sure how it adds up to 32 GB, but on my local machine, the LibreTranslate volume alone uses 5 GB. AFAIK the language model is downloaded when the container first boots. The LibreTranslate image is another 600 MB.

With this PR LibreTranslate and Elasticsearch are not started automatically, so the development environment is able to boot. People with paid access to Codespaces can easily update devcontainer.json if they wish to start either of these services.

Fixes #25932.

issues.issue_title: Added SMTP_FROM_ADDRESS to heroku deploy config
issues.issue_body:
Allows the user to set the address mastodon emails are maraked as being sent from

Addressing issue #638

issues.issue_title: CNs can not contain clickable hashtags or links
issues.issue_body:
500 characters are really a lot, so sometimes I use the CN field for other things than content notices, just to be able to have the "show more" button. This way I can let the users choose whether they like to read on, without disrupting their timelines with longposts. For example:

* when adding images, write the actual content of the toot into the CN field, then use the "main toot area" for image descriptions (for people using only text-to-speech interfaces)
* general long posts: use the CN field for a short title or excerpt (e.g. title of an journal article, including a link to it), and a longer excerpt or discussion goes into the main toot.

However, text in the CN field is not transformed to links, so hashtags, user mentions, or links to other pages are not clickable. I'd like them to be clickable.

But maybe I'm using this all wrong and the title of this issue should rather be *implement a more generic "show more" feature*? I could think of a special tag, like "<!--more-->" in Wordpress, which makes the post appear shortened when it appears in the content.

* * * *

- [x] I searched or browsed the repo’s other issues to ensure this is not a duplicate.
- [ ] This bug happens on a [tagged release](https://github.com/tootsuite/mastodon/releases) and not on `master` (If you're a user, don't worry about this).

commit.commit_title: Add auto-refresh of accounts we get new messages/edits of (#26510)

prs.pr_title: Add auto-refresh of accounts we get new messages/edits of
prs.pr_body:
Mastodon already refreshes accounts in various edge cases but otherwise relies on getting `Update` activities.

This PR schedules an update when processing a new or updated post from a remote account, but:
- updates are only scheduled if the account has not been refreshed in the last 7 days: this is to avoid too frequent updates
- updates are scheduled at random in a 6 hours interval: this is to avoid the thundering herd problem

This is motivated by a possible issue highlighted in https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26344#pullrequestreview-1580465810

TODO: assess performance implications, and find if existing refresh paths could use this new pattern, although that last bit could be done in a different PR

EDIT: decreased refresh frequency as well as schedule jitter to reduce the number of queued tasks

prs.pr_title: Add Elasticsearch cluster health check and indexes mismatch check to dashboard
prs.pr_body:
Fixes #26417

Note that it should not be merged right away, because under current configuration, single-node Elasticsearch deployments will always have yellow health at best.

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/1d9978ee-bc89-470a-be5b-eb8e7c4ba541)
![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/237965f6-ed11-470f-8499-9499cbefe6ef)

issues.issue_title: Check ElasticSearch cluster health in admin dashboard
issues.issue_body:
### Pitch

In addition to [the version check](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/blob/main/app/lib/admin/system_check/elasticsearch_check.rb), we should also check the cluster status (`client.cluster.health["status"]`) and show a warning/error if it is yellow/red.

A yellow status usually means that replicas are not assigned (one of your nodes are down?), red usually means that shard data is not available and that search is not working properly, or not at all, and your cluster is very unhealthy. 

### Motivation

I suspect many people deployed ElasticSearch on their instance, but do not have proper monitoring in place and do not know that their cluster is having issues, causing search to either not work, work on only some data, or is very slow.

Note: this should only be done after the recent work on setting the proper count for shards/replica is done, as at the moment every single-node ES cluster would be yellow as Mastodon always sets `number_of_replicas` to 1.

commit.commit_title: Remove hashtags from the last line of a status if it only contains hashtags (#26499)

prs.pr_title: Remove hashtags from the last line of a status if it only contains hashtags
prs.pr_body: This should have the same effect as #26260, but done in the frontend directly. It avoids removing the hashtags from the original status text, as this breaks compatibility with older clients and instance which do not (yet) support displaying out-of-band hashtags. Once enough of the ecosystem moved to display out-of-band hashtags properly, then we can probably switch to removing them from the content at the time of posting. I tried to comment the code so it is understandable, and it uses proper Typescript (except for the state types that I needed to work around, as our state is not-yet typed). There are also tests covering the cases I could think of. I chose to have a helper function do the work, so we only need to parse the content once, and the results are used in 2 places (the hashtag bar and ``). It allows the code handling the hashtags to be co-located. Cases that I handled: - full out-of-band hashtags (not included in the status content) - if the last line of a status is only hashtags, they are moved to the dedicated bar - if a hashtag in the last line appears in the content, then is it not added to the bar - case variations do not matter (hashtags are all lowercase internally, but may have different cases in the post) - but if there are case variations of the same hashtag (for example in the last line), then we choose one of those only to be in the hashtag bar. I chose to go with the one having the most difference between upper and lower case letters, to try to select the most camel-cased one (this is important for accessibility) - if there is only one line with only hashtags in the content, and the status has a media, then we do not show any content and display the hashtags in the bar. But not if the status has a CW, otherwise the CW hides zero content and this is weird Something that is not specifically handled is the order of the hashtags in the bar, but I am not sure of what to decide here. Before: After: I wonder if this should not be done server-side, with a new API parameter to tell the server that you support displaying out-of-band hashtags, so the server can serve the already-trimmed text, but this is probably more complex to implement.

### Added

- **Add “Privacy and reach” tab in profile settings** ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26484), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26508))
  This reorganized scattered privacy and reach settings to a single place, as well as improve their wording.
- **Add display of out-of-band hashtags in the web interface** ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26492), [arbolitoloco1](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26497), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26506), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26525))
- **Add auto-refresh of accounts we get new messages/edits of** ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26510))
- **Add Elasticsearch cluster health check and indexes mismatch check to dashboard** ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26448))
- **Add support for `indexable` attribute on remote actors** ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26485))
- Add `DELETE /api/v1/profile/avatar` and `DELETE /api/v1/profile/header` to the REST API ([danielmbrasil](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/25124), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26573))
- Add `S3_DISABLE_CHECKSUM_MODE` environment variable for compatibility with some S3-compatible providers ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26435))
- Add `ES_PRESET` option to customize numbers of shards and replicas ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26483), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26489))
  This can have a value of `single_node_cluster` (default), `small_cluster` (uses one replica) or `large_cluster` (uses one replica and a higher number of shards).
- Add missing `instances` option to `tootctl search deploy` ([tribela](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26461))
- Add `CACHE_BUSTER_HTTP_METHOD` environment variable ([renchap](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26528), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26542))
- Add support for `DB_PASS` when using `DATABASE_URL` ([ThisIsMissEm](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26295))

### Changed

- **Change hashtags to be displayed separately when they are the last line of a post** ([renchap](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26499))
- **Change the hashtag column to not display the hashtag header on pinned columns** ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26416))
- Change follow recommendation materialized view to be faster in most cases ([renchap, ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26545))
- Change `robots.txt` to block GPTBot ([Foritus](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26396))

### Removed

### Fixed

- Fix reply not preserving the language from the replied-to post ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26452))
- Fix "Create Account" button in interaction modal ([mgmn](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26459))
- Fix unfollow icon styling in advanced column ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26482))
- Fix “legal” report category not showing up in moderation interface ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26509))

- Fix uploading of video files for which `ffprobe` reports `0/0` average framerate ([NicolaiSoeborg](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26500))
